intro: Monelasmum laxiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered monelasmum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. The leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface depending on the variety.
